title: A briefe representation of the sad and lamentable condition of that once flourishing town of Marlborough, in Wiltshire, as it hath been represented by severall letters from credible persons of that place to their friends in London.
author: Bayly, Thomas, d. 1657?
notes: Composed of 4 letters written in April 1653 by Thomas Bayly, John Keynes, John Hammond, and Thomas Keynton.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
